statement.p: Quinidine gluconate is a liquid mixture, part medicine and part water, which is administered intravenously. There are 70.0 mg of quinidine gluconate in each cubic centimeter (cc) of the liquid mixture. Dr. Perez orders 168 mg of quinidine gluconate to be administered daily to a patient with malaria.
How much of the solution would have to be administered to achieve the recommended daily dosage?Â
